did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.physdesc: Financial documents, photographs, printed materials, publications
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Documentation of all Outing Club activities between 1930 and 2012, and maps of the surrounding areas. Meeting minutes, financial statements, membership lists, and other items documenting the clubs activities are included.

bioghist.head: ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: In the 1950s college outing clubs in the northeast associated in the Intercollegiate Outing Clubs Association (IOCA) which sponsored numerous events. In 1952 a Finger Lakes Regional IOCA was established for local colleges and universities.The Cornell Outing Club has been an active part of Cornell life since the 1920s.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Newsletters from the Cornell Outing Club and the Finger Lakes Regional club; "The Outing Club Handbook"; and photographs, with some identification, from the Cornell Outing Club and the Intercollegiate Outing Club Annual Conference in 1952, collected by Hugh E. Kingery '54. This collection includes photos, trip history, budget history, and newsletters. Documentation of all Outing Club activities between 1930 and 2012, and maps of the surrounding areas. Meeting minutes, financial statements, membership lists, and other items documenting the clubs activities are included. Many photographs of events on Beebe Lake and on trips are included, camping, caving, ice climbing, Japes Lodge, etc..

controlaccess.head: Names:
controlaccess.corpname: Finger Lakes Regional Intercollegiate Outing Clubs Association.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Cornell Outing Club records, #37-6-3416. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

did.unittitle: Trips that were, gear accounted for
"A One Track Trip for a One Track Mind" Alfred Davidson
Trails of New England and surrounding areas
Rental Agreements of Various Outing Clubs
American Kayaking Association and other organizations
Old equipment inventories and rental rates
Guidelines and procedures for trip leaders
Dripstone: masters and copies of masthead and section headings
New York state climbing and caving
Safety: accident report forms and rescue info
Maps of West Virginia: road maps
Cave maps, surveys, and misc info (New York State)
Valid vouchers candidates and Japes rent
Intercollegiate Outing Club Association (IOCA) 1941 3rd Annual Song Fest book

scopecontent.p: Owned by Bill Sumner, Algonquin Lodge.
Includes photos of Beebe Lake, including winter carnival
Photos some labeled and some not, include images from trips and members over several decades. Trips include camping, caving, activities on Beebe Lake, and others.
